intro: Pouzolzia meeboldii, commonly known as the Meebold's pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Pouzolzia meeboldii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments.
